REQ-PROG-001.title: Feature Unlocks
REQ-PROG-001.notes: Turn-based feature unlock schedule: Diplomacy (Turn 20), Black Market (Turn 50), Nuclear Weapons (Turn 100). Can be implemented as standalone unlock gate system.

REQ-PROG-002.title: Game Checkpoints

blockers.reason: Checkpoints triggered at turn thresholds (every 20 turns); turn system provides trigger points. Can implement with manual timestamps as workaround.

REQ-PROG-002.notes: Save/load system with auto-checkpoints (every 20 turns), manual saves (max 3), cloud storage, 7/30-day retention. Core infrastructure for long campaign games.

REQ-PROG-003.title: Galactic Events

blockers.reason: Event triggers evaluated each turn (3% chance per turn); requires turn processing system to execute trigger checks and apply effects

REQ-PROG-003.notes: 8 event types (Supernova, Plague, Golden Age, Rebellion, Wormhole Collapse, Tech Breakthrough, Galactic War, Resource Boom) affecting all empires. Average 1 event per 30 turns.

REQ-PROG-004.title: Tutorial Sequence

blockers.reason: Tutorial progresses across Turns 1-10; turn system marks tutorial phase boundaries. Can implement with manual progression tracking.

REQ-PROG-004.notes: 10-turn guided onboarding teaching core mechanics (sectors, building, military, resources, trading, borders, combat). Success criteria and rewards per turn. Skip option after Turn 3.

REQ-PROG-005.title: Bot Tutorial Passivity

blockers.reason: Requires bot archetype system to apply per-archetype behavior modifiers (Warlord: 0.9â†’0.3, Blitzkrieg: delay rush to Turn 15+)
Uses tutorial phase detection (Turns 1-10); can hardcode turn range if tutorial spec not available
Applies modifiers during tutorial phase; turn counter determines active phase

REQ-PROG-005.notes: Reduced bot aggression during tutorial: 50% damage reduction, lowered attack priority (0.3), delayed rush attacks. Returns to normal after Turn 10 or tutorial skip.

REQ-PROG-006.title: Event Announcements

blockers.reason: Announces galactic events 1 turn before trigger; requires event system to exist to generate announcements
Announcement timing keyed to turn processing; turn counter determines when to display warnings

REQ-PROG-006.notes: Notifications 1 turn before event (except Supernova), active event banner during duration with turn counter, end summary. Creates anticipation and player reaction time.

implementationWaves.wave0_turn_system_required: REQ-TURN-001 must be implemented first - gates all progressive features
wave1_foundational: REQ-PROG-002 (Checkpoints - soft dep on turns, can implement with timestamps)
wave2_core_systems: REQ-PROG-004 (Tutorial - uses turn phase, can implement standalone)
wave3_complex_mechanics: REQ-PROG-003 (Galactic Events - hard dep on turn triggers)
wave4_integrations: REQ-PROG-005 (Bot Tutorial Passivity - requires BOT system)

criticalPath.reason: 5 of 6 progressive specs depend on turn system. Turn processing is the gating factor.
criticalPath.recommendation: Prioritize REQ-TURN-001 to unblock progressive feature implementation. Features 1-2 can proceed in parallel with turn system. Feature 3 must wait for turn system completion.

keyObservations: Progressive system is heavily integrated with turn system - 83% of specs depend on REQ-TURN-001
Bot system integration only required for tutorial passivity (REQ-PROG-005), not core progressive features
Two specs can be implemented immediately (unlocks, checkpoints) while waiting for turn system
Event system and announcements tightly coupled (REQ-PROG-006 requires REQ-PROG-003)
No circular dependencies detected - clear implementation order possible
Tutorial and bot passivity linked - bots adjust behavior when tutorial is active

highRisk.risk: Hard blocker on turn system. Galactic events cannot function without turn processing.
highRisk.mitigation: Implement turn system first. Can stub events with placeholder triggers during turn system work.

mediumRisk.risk: Requires bot archetype system (REQ-BOT-001). May not exist or may have different design.
mediumRisk.mitigation: Verify bot system exists before implementing. Could stub with global damage multiplier if per-bot modifiers don't exist.
